Selecting the Weights: 
- Choose a pair of dumbbells or kettlebells with a weight that challenges you but allows you to maintain proper form throughout the exercise. 
- The weight should be heavy enough to provide resistance but not so heavy that it compromises your ability to walk with good posture. 
Setting Up: 
- Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart, and place the weights on the ground on either side of your body.

Gripping the Weights: 
- Bend at the knees and hinge at the hips to reach down and grasp the handles of the weights firmly with an overhand grip.

Lifting the Weights: 
- Engage your core muscles and lift the weights off the ground by straightening your knees and extending your hips. 
- Keep your back flat, chest up, and shoulders pulled back and down throughout the movement to maintain a stable posture. 
- Begin walking forward in a controlled manner, taking slow and deliberate steps while holding the weights at your sides.
